name: Grand Unification Epoch
description: The earliest elementary particles are created and the force of gravity separates from the other fundamental forces.

name: Inflationary Epoch
description: The universe inflates exponentially, triggered by the separation of the strong nuclear force from the other fundamental forces. The universe grows to a 'quark soup' about ten centimeters across

name: Electroweak Epoch
description: The strong nuclear force separates, Higgs bosons are created and therefore particles begin to have mass.

name: Quark Epoch
description: The remaining fundamental forces separate into their current forms, the universe cools to 10 billion billion degrees, quarks, electrons and neutrinos form.

name: Hadron Epoch
description: The universe cools to a trillion degrees. Protons and neutrons (and other hadrons) form, then most annihilate with their antimatter counterparts.

name: Lepton Epoch
description: After the hadrons mostly annihilated, the universe is dominated by leptons such as electrons, and antileptons (such as positrons). Most annihilate each other by the end of this epoch.

name: Nucleosynthesis
description: The universe, having cooled to about a billion degrees, begins fusing protons and neutrons to form helium and lithium nuclei.

name: Photon Epoch
description: The universe is filled with plasma, a hot soup of atomic nuclei and electrons interacting with photons that formed at the end of the Lepton Epoch.

name: Recombination/Decoupling
description: The universe cools to 3000 degrees, about the temperature of the surface ofthe sun. Electrons and nuclei combine to form atoms, and the universe becomes transparent to light.

name: Dark Era
description: Atoms have formed but not yet stars. The universe is dominated by dark matter.

name: Reionization
description: The first quasars form, ionizing the surrounding unicerse. The universe is now dominated by ionized plasma.

name: Solar System Formation
description: Our sun and solar system form from the debris from earlier supernovae.
